articles.author: Rita Liao
articles.title: China tech further severed from US fundings after Biden ban | TechCrunch
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed an executive order barring U.S. investments in certain tech sectors of China, confirming rumors that have been
articles.content: President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed an executive order barring U.S. investments in certain tech sectors of China, confirming rumors that have been swirling for months that Washington would ramp u [+2986 chars]
articles.summary: President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed an executive order barring U S investments in certain tech sectors of China. The order authorizes the U S Secretary of the Treasury to restrict U S investment in three critical categories of Chinese companies semiconductors and microelectronics quantum computing and artificial intelligence that is critical for the military intelligence surveillance or cyber enabled capabilities. The measure is expected to take effect next year according to The Washington Post It also applies to companies in Hong Kong Advancements in sensitive technologies and products in these sectors will accelerate the development of advanced computational capabilities that pose significant national security risks.
articles.html_summary:
• President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed an executive order barring U S investments in certain tech sectors of China
  • The order authorizes the U S Secretary of the Treasury to restrict U S investment in three critical categories of Chinese companies semiconductors and microelectronics quantum computing and artificial intelligence that is critical for the military intelligence surveillance or cyber enabled capabilities
  • The measure is expected to take effect next year according to The Washington Post It also applies to companies in Hong Kong Advancements in sensitive technologies and products in these sectors will accelerate the development of advanced computational capabilities that pose significant national security risks

articles.title: Disney+ announces another price hike, says adsupported tier is coming to more countries | TechCrunch
articles.description: Disney+ announces another price hike, says adsupported tier is coming to more countries | TechCrunchtechcrunch.com
articles.content: Disney is raising prices for its online streaming services across the board amid a declining subscriber base. This is the companys second price hike in the last 12 months after it increased subscrip [+2886 chars]
articles.summary: Disney is raising prices for its online streaming services across the board amid a declining subscriber base. This is the company s second price hike in the last months after it increased subscription fees for different offerings including Disney and Hulu last October. The company is also introducing a new ad free bundle of Disney andHuluat per month. Ad supported tiers for both services will remain at per month Disney said that these new tariffs will be applicable from October. Disney s domestic subscriber base across the U S and Canada dipped from million to million in the the last three months.
articles.html_summary:
• Disney is raising prices for its online streaming services across the board amid a declining subscriber base
  • This is the company s second price hike in the last months after it increased subscription fees for different offerings including Disney and Hulu last October
  • The company is also introducing a new ad free bundle of Disney and Hulu at per month
  • Ad supported tiers for both services will remain at per month Disney said that these new tariffs will be applicable from October
  • Disney s domestic subscriber base across the U S and Canada dipped from million to million in the the last three months
